results.title: The Unfinished revolution
results.creator_credit: Michael Alexander and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: A survey of the extremes of great wealth and great poverty in Mexico, and the extent to which this contrast has been affected by the Revolution.

results.title: The Unfair go
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Con Anemogiannis and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A 6 part program which uses comments from academics, social workers and politicians to discuss the welfare system in Australia. Explores the plight and welfare of Australians and analyses the state of our welfare system in relation to Great Britain, United States, Sweden, Soviet Union, Uruguay and Peru. Contents: The growing divide (29 min.), A net full of holes (28 min.), The sorry state (29 min.), The kindness of strangers (29 min.), Battlers or bludgers (29 min.), Who gives a buck (28 min.). Narrated by Jim Downes.

results.title: The Unexplained cannibals
results.brief_description: Is cannibalism part of human nature? That is the question posed to us in this documentary that looks at cannibalism from ancient human history to modern day incidents. Society’s dual fascination and revulsion of the subject has made cannibalism a continual taboo. Psychiatrists believe it is human nature and when the mind adapts and survival depends on it - we accept it. The practise of cannibalism is one of survival, tribal ritual and madness. We look at the factors affecting the Donner party in 1846, a group of pioneers heading to California who became stranded in a snow storm and had to partake in cannibalism for their survival. We are introduced to Ed Gein, one of America’s most notorious serial killers who used to boil up parts of his victim’s bodies to eat, and learn about the religious rituals practised by tribes of New Guinea, as related by anthropologist Fitz John Poole PD who lived with the tribes for three years. The documentary looks at the various reasons behind why people become cannibals and poses the question, “why is it such a psychological taboo?”.

results.title: The Unending search
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane, Australian Agricultural Council and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: The role of scientific research in the development of Australian agriculture including the elimination of all the major cattle diseases and most sheep diseases; improved pastures so that they can carry more than twice the original number of livestock; increased crop yields; and better breeds of livestock.

results.title: The Underground movie
results.creator_credit: Les Drew, Joseph Koenig and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Everyone has wondered what it would be like to dig right through to the other side of the Earth. This animated film takes the wonder a step further. Here the probe is accomplished with a machine as ingenious as any that have reached the moon. Dubbed “Old Chucknose” and equipped with amazing gadgetry, it bores through every layer of the Earth’s crust and centre. Perhaps it’s not a blueprint of things to come, but it’s plausible enough as observed in this cartoon. (Award: Adelaide.)

results.title: The Undefeated
results.creator_credit: Paul Dickson, James Carr and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: The story of a young glider pilot who lost both his legs and the power of speech during the war, yet was determined to become an active and useful member of the community once more. The film tells how, through his own courage and endurance, and the help of others, he was able to achieve this ambition.

results.title: The Unconscious casualty
results.creator_credit: Robert Littlewood and Safe Work Video
results.brief_description: Produced with the supervision of the Ambulance Service and St John’s Ambulance first aid trainers, this dramatised didactic first aid video details the steps involved in the DRABC system of managing the Unconscious casualty. The video aims to educate the inexperienced about the crucial steps in this emergency response. No previous first aid training is required although this video can be used effectively for ‘refresher’ training.

results.title: The Unbelievable story
results.brief_description: A small boy who is admiring a large car, is chased away when the owner returns. Later, when the car breaks down, he offers help and then tows it away, leaving the owner on the ground. When the owner gives chase, the body of the car detaches itself, leaving only the chassis.

results.title: The Umbrella man
results.creator_credit: Ronald Fleher, Ben Park and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the establishment of an umbrella factory run entirely by disabled persons in Addis Ababa. Today, the self-supporting disabled, acquire in this pilot factory, a sense of their own usefulness and dignity. Moreover the factory saves Ethiopia valuable foreign exchange.

results.title: The Ultimate Thrill Skydiving
results.brief_description: Experience the ultimate thrill of skydiving in this incredible video that gives you an inside look at this unique sport. View all aspects of skydiving from preparation, jumping and freefall, to stunts and landings with detailed photography that allows you to see all the action. Filmed from a skydiver’s perspective, experience the panoramic views only possible through this sport. In addition to giving you an educational and interesting look at this remarkable sport, you will also be entertained by the fast-paced action.
